column1: Madikeri (also known by its former name Mercara) is a hill station town in Madikeri taluk in Kodagu district
column2: India. It is the headquarters of the district of Kodagu.

column1: Madikeri was known as Muddu Raja Keri
column3: was named after the prominent Haleri king Mudduraja who ruled Kodagu from 1633 to 1687. From 1834
column5: it was called Mercara. It was later renamed to Madikeri by the Government of Mysore.

column1: The history of Madikeri is related to the history of Kodagu. From the 2nd to the 6th century AD
column2: the northern part of Kodagu was ruled by Kadambas. The southern part of Kodagu was ruled by Gangas from the 4th to the 11th century. After defeating the Gangas in the 11th century
column3: Cholas became the rulers of Kodagu. In the 12th century
column4: the Cholas lost Kodagu to the Hoysalas. Kodagu fell to the Vijayanagar kings in the 14th century. After their fall
column5: the local chieftains like Karnambahu (Palegars) started ruling their areas directly. They were defeated by Haleri Dynasty founder Veeraraju
column6: (Nephew of Ikkeri Sadashiva Nayaka who were descendants of Talakadu Ganga Dynasty)
column7: . In the year 1700AD Ikkeri Somashekara Nayaka gifted Puttur and Amara Sullia Magnes of Tulunadu to Haleri Kings. Descendants of Veeraraju who are known as "Haleri Dynasty" ruled Kodagu from 1600-1834 AD. Haleri king Mudduraja built the Fort in Madikeri and made it as their capital. Mudduraja
column8: the third Haleri king started leveling the land around Madikeri and built a fort in the year 1681. Madikeri Fort which was original built of mud and was replaced by Tipu Sultan. Kodagu became the part of British India after 1834 AD.

column1: Madikeri features a tropical highland climate as it has an elevation of 1150 metres  (3838 feet). Madikeri is located at 12.42°N 75.73°E﻿ / 12.42; 75.73. Madikeri lies in the Western Ghats and is a popular hill station. The nearest cities are Hassan to the north
column3: and Mysuru to the east.Kannur from Kerala is about 100 km away from here. The nearest international airport is Kannur International airport which is 80 km away from here.
